title: Forever101
author: Forever101
content: Bitcoins has created its own history over the years even till now. Bitcoins has become famous across the world however, there several areas that need to be touched as to have a wider acceptance of bitcoins across Nigeria. The economy situation in Nigeria has force every Nigerian youth to discovering the impact of bitcoins. The religious leaders have also impacted the growth of bitcoins in Nigeria, as some believed bitcoins is demonic , not good for religious people, describing it as betting or Ponzi scheme. The fight of the government against bitcoins in most cases is due to proper comprehension of the mechanism of the system. It become difficult for them to accept. Until this gap is covered by crypto learned people in the government house and religious places , it may continue to post some kind of threat. I remember a member of house of senate fighting for bitcoins restoration in Nigeria and his description was about his son owning 2 bitcoins that worth 40million naira. I believe what he look after is the profit not the technology.  We can see that this gaps is a major threat to the bitcoins in many countries today. Many person have argued that, in Nigeria we have no problem with government barning Cryptocurrency. They forgot that government can also go a long way to stop  exchanges from allowing Nigerians trade. I know the current administration has not said anything about bitcoins . Only letting everyone know the gap that need to be covered.If there is no voice in the council of decision making , we can expect anything. Bitcoins army in Nigeria, let's rise to our feet

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Forever101 on June 24, 2023, 02:39:57 PMThe religious leaders have also impacted the growth of bitcoins in Nigeria, as some believed bitcoins is demonic , not good for religious people, describing it as betting or Ponzi scheme. Wow! I think this is my first time hearing that some religious leaders actually did talked about Bitcoin been demonic and not good for religious people, as never did i saw any pastor or a Muslim Imam making a news headline about such statement. But moreover, i'm not doubting the fact that some might not have said such privately in their various churches or mosque due to lack of knowledge about what is Bitcoin & how Bitcoin work, and might have mistook it for a Ponzi scheme or gambling, which in most case, it's okay base on their level of understanding. But as an educated person, what you do next matters the most, as it's not everything they tell you you ought to just accept it just like that without making the necessary research and findings, which I think is the mistake most people make.QuoteMany person have argued that, in Nigeria we have no problem with government barning Cryptocurrency. They forgot that government can also go a long way to stop  exchanges from allowing Nigerians trade. Yes, it's true that government can go a long way to stopping exchange from operating in Nigeria, and likewise stopping crypto traders from doing their businesses which is mostly exchange centered base, but that doesn't mean that they can stop people from owing Bitcoin (i.e Buying & Selling) in Nigeria, because with the help of p2p market place, all those can be done conveniently, and likewise with the help of V.P.N which we were able to use to bypass the Twitter ban last time.
